Title.evidence: CALGB 140503: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Sub-lobar Resection to Lobectomy for Stage IA NSCLC

Trial_Design.evidence: multi-center randomised controlled trial assessing whether sub-lobar resection is equivalent to lobectomy for stage IA non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) ≤ 2 cm in diameter

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants had suspected stage IA NSCLC ≤ 2 cm

Intervention.evidence: sub-lobar resection is equivalent to lobectomy

Objective.evidence: assessing whether sub-lobar resection is equivalent to lobectomy for stage IA non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) ≤ 2 cm in diameter

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival, assessed over 5 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Due to the surgical nature of interventions, blinding was not feasible

Number_Randomised.evidence: Conducted from June 15, 2007, to March 22, 2013, the trial preregistered 637 patients across multiple centers

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: Preoperative biopsy significantly increased randomisation rates (p<0.001)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to randomisation were reported

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial is registered under NCT00499330

Funding.evidence: funded by the National Cancer Institute
